intro: Streptocarpus rungwensis, commonly known as the Rungwe streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern African region, particularly Tanzania. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple and blue. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found growing in rocky or forested areas. Due to its unique beauty and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
